div.pre: 1789 Persepolis, Persist 1933 (806) Burial: before 511 B.C. (Schmidt) Contents: 8 AV, 4 AR A. Abdera: 1 tetradr. Aegina: 1 st. Lydia: 4 AV Croeseids (light) B. "Paphus": 1 st. Unc. Cypriote: 1 st. (lion's hd. r./bull charging l.) Lydia: 4 AV Croeseids (light) Disposition: Teheran Herzfeld, TINC, pp. 413-4, illus. Schlumberger, L'argent grec, p. 11, no. 43 Schmidt, Persepolis 2 (Chicago, 1957), pp. 110, 113-4, illus. The two lots represent a foundation deposit found at the northeast (A) and south- east (B) corners of the main hall of the Apadana beneath the stone boxes containing the tablets of Darius I. Herzfeld's rather ambiguous text has gen- erally been understood to say that the hd. contained four Croeseids in all. Schmidt, however, lists and illustrates four from each lot. To lot (B) Schmidt adds another uncertain Cypriote stater (as NC 1935, pl. 15, nos. 6-7), but this issue can hardly be dated before 511 B.C.
